tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The universe, in its silent language, sings the praises of and describes the attributes of its Creator. The fact is the universe is the vehicle of God’s praises, while the Quran is their verbal recitation
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Hadid, Ayah 8?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But when Islam has already been crowned by success, every individual is able to see its greatness and everybody feels proud of coming forward and offering his life and property for its sake

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The insight which had become their guide in this world will, by the grace of God, serve as a guide also in the Hereafter. For those who prove to have this insight in the world, it will become easy on the Day of Judgement; by making use of their insight, they will be able to pass more easily throu...

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Just as the earth becomes fresh and green when it receives water, so also should the individual awaken from his moral torpor when he hears clear arguments

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In an atmosphere of doubt about the Truth, they were able to see the Truth. Such action on their part will become a beacon for them in the Hereafter

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the central theme of this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: God has created examples of the Hereafter in this world. Similarly, the glamour of this world is also temporary

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The receiving of things in the world or the losing of them is purely for the purpose of putting man to the test. The correct and required reaction is that a man should not be disheartened if he suffers some loss, nor should he develop feelings of pride and vanity if he gains something

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Just as man measures excess or shortage by means of a balance, similarly, God’s book is also a balance for Truth. The balance—or the Scales of Justice—is a symbol of the following of religion by its adherents

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who had faith in the previous prophet and now, having discovered the Truth in the call of the Last of the Prophets, adopt his faith, are entitled to a double reward

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse primarily teach us?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The Prophet, taking into account the old custom, opined that she stood forbidden for Aws ibn as-Samit. Before Islam, it was the custom in Arabia that if a man said to his wife, ‘To me you are like my mother’s back’ she was for ever forbidden for that man
